content.question: A fair die with its faces numbered from 1 to 6 will be rolled. Which of the following is the best interpretation of the probability that the number landing face up will be less than 3 ?

choices.label: For many rolls of the die, the long-run relative frequency of a number less than 3 landing face up is <math alttext="one third" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

For many rolls of the die, the long-run relative frequency of a number less than 3 landing face up is <math alttext="one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

For many rolls of the die, the long-run relative frequency of a number less than 3 landing face up is <math alttext="two thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.
For three rolls of the die, a number less than 3 will land face up one time.
It will take three rolls of the die before a number less than 3 lands face up for the first time.

content.answer: For many rolls of the die, the long-run relative frequency of a number less than 3 landing face up is <math alttext="one third" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
